description: System-generated unique identifier for the maintenance task record; used as the primary key for joins and references.
Short code or title identifying the maintenance task used in maintenance planning, PM programs, and work orders.
Full, human-readable description of the maintenance task's purpose and scope.
Boolean flag indicating if the task is safety-critical or required for regulatory compliance.
Planned vehicle out-of-service time, in hours, to complete this task; used for scheduling and capacity planning.
Coded lifecycle state of the task definition (e.g., active/inactive); exact code meanings should be confirmed with SME.
Abbreviated label or printed text (often with symbol prefix) shown on work orders or shop boards for this task.
User account recorded as the most recent updater; may include automated processes. Legacy field - confirm authoritative source.
Free-text administrative notes about the task, instructions, or special considerations.
System-maintained timestamp of the most recent change to this task record.
Legacy audit timestamp for the last modification; may duplicate other modified dates - confirm usage with SME.
User account that initially created the task record.
Timestamp when the task record was originally created.
User account that last updated the task record.
Timestamp when the user in the modifier field last saved changes to this record.
